uniol.apt.analysis.sideconditions

Class SideCondition

  • java.lang.Object
    • uniol.apt.analysis.sideconditions.SideCondition

  • public class SideCondition
extends java.lang.Object
    Datatype for a side condition. A side condition is a self loop of a place and a transition, including it's two arcs.
    Author:
    CS

    • Constructor Summary

      • SideCondition

        public SideCondition(Place p,
                     Transition t,
                     Flow placeToTransitionArc,
                     Flow transitionToPlaceArc)
        Constructor for Sideconditon. A side condition is a self loop of a place and a transition, including it's two arcs.
        Parameters:
        p - the place
        t - the transiton
        placeToTransitionArc - the arc that goes from place to transition.
        transitionToPlaceArc - the arc that goes from transition to place.

      • isSimple

        public boolean isSimple()
        Checks if the side condition is simple. A side condition is simple, when both arc weights are 1.
        Returns:
        true when the side condition is simple.
